description: From Latin strīdor (“shrill or harsh sound”), from strīdō (“make a shrill or harsh sound”).

entries.meaning: (medicine) A high-pitched sound heard on inspiration resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway usually indicative of serious airway obstruction.
examples: Her breath-holding increased in duration to almost a minute; her expirations became complicated by stridor, forced retching, and forced phonations ('Oouuggh!').
